oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ethyl isocyanoacetate as a useful glycine equivalent
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
HALDER, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: glycine equivalents
amino acids
isocyanides
phase-transfer catalysis
cycloadditions
metathesis
suzuki coupling
alpha-amino-acid
ring-closing metathesis
cross-coupling reaction
cyclic 1-amino-1-carboxylic acids
2+2+2 cycloaddition strategy
diels-alder reaction
crystal packing
metalated isocyanides
organic-synthesis
carboxylic-acids
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this account, we describe a useful synthetic approach to construct diverse constrained alpha,alpha-dialkylated amino acid derivatives using ethyl isocyanoacetate as a glycine equivalent. Various unusual amino acid derivatives, such as cyclophane-, benzocyclo-butene-, and diene-containing systems, are reported here.
